intro: Amparoa madrensis, commonly known as the Madren's amparoa, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, thriving in high-altitude environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Amparoa madrensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
